body:
<!-- This form is for bug reports and feature requests ONLY!

If you're looking for help check [Stack Overflow](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/kubernetes) and the [troubleshooting guide](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/debug-application-cluster/troubleshooting/).

If the matter is security related, please disclose it privately via https://kubernetes.io/security/.
-->

**Is this a BUG REPORT or FEATURE REQUEST?**:


/kind bug



**What happened**:
After setting up kube-proxy, and static routing. The node is not forwarding the ClusterIP of a service.
Services are accessible if the default policy filter FORWARD chain is set to ACCEPT, but not DROP.

**What you expected to happen**:
nodes should be forwarding ClusterIP from external cluster to the correctly Pod IP.

**How to reproduce it (as minimally and precisely as possible)**:
1. Setup K8S cluser.
2. Deploy NGINX and ClusterIP type of service for NGINX.
3. Setup static routing from external.
4. Access from external with curl.

**Anything else we need to know?**:
The filter table function seems dropped since merge of 029a16a1ebd85efc8c66abe431b657e6cad06540.
However the github merge request dosen't seem to relate to removing the functionality.
Is this a merge issue? or intentienal?

**Environment**:
- Kubernetes version (use `kubectl version`):
```
Client Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11+", GitVersion:"v1.11.2-2+aeff1f5f480767", GitCommit:"aeff1f5f480767c6a0f03717b7356892991ac2f7", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-08-23T02:40:37Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
Server Version: version.Info{Major:"1", Minor:"11", GitVersion:"v1.11.2", GitCommit:"bb9ffb1654d4a729bb4cec18ff088eacc153c239", GitTreeState:"clean", BuildDate:"2018-08-07T23:08:19Z", GoVersion:"go1.10.3", Compiler:"gc", Platform:"linux/amd64"}
```
- Cloud provider or hardware configuration:
```
Local VM setup.
```
- OS (e.g. from /etc/os-release):
```
VERSION="9 (stretch)"
ID=debian
HOME_URL="https://www.debian.org/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://www.debian.org/support"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.debian.org/"
```
- Kernel (e.g. `uname -a`):
```
Linux master1 4.9.0-8-amd64 #1 SMP Debian 4.9.110-3+deb9u4 (2018-08-21) x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
- Install tools:
```
Manually
```
- Others:

labels.description: Categorizes issue or PR as related to a bug.
labels.name: kind/bug

labels.description: Categorizes an issue or PR as relevant to SIG Network.
labels.name: sig/network

title: kube-proxy ipvs mode does not populate filter table. (merge issue or intentional?)
